src:
Elena Ferrante z novim romanom o zlaganem življenju odraslih
04 Nov 2019, 11:39 by STA

V Italiji bo v četrtek izšel novi roman italijanske pisateljice, ki se predstavlja s psevdonimom Elena Ferrante. Avtorica slovitega Neapeljskega cikla je novo knjigo naslovila La vita bugiarda degli adulti (Zlagano življenje odraslih), na naslovnici italijanske izdaje pa sta ženski roki, postavljeni, kot bi želeli nekaj nežno prijeti.



Naslovnica nove knjige Elene Ferrante, ki bo izšla v četrtek. 

RIM > Italijanska tiskovna agencija Ansa piše, da bo novi roman Elene Ferrante skoraj zagotovo postavljen v Neapelj, kar naj bi nakazoval odlomek iz dela, objavljen v septembru: "Dve leti, preden je odšel od doma, je moj oče dejal materi, da sem zelo grda. Stavek je izrekel potiho, v stanovanju, ki sta ga starša ob poroki kupila v četrti Alto, na vrhu ulice San Giacomo dei Capri. Vse - neapeljski prostori, modra luč ledenega februarja, tiste besede - je otrpnilo. Jaz pa sem zdrsnila stran in še vedno drsim znotraj teh črt, ki mi želijo dati zgodbo, medtem ko nisem nič, nič svojega, nič, kar bi se v resnici začelo ali bi se resnično sklenilo: zgolj zmešnjava, za katero nihče, niti tisti, ki ta hip piše, ne ve, ali sledi pripovedni niti ali pa gre zgolj za neurejeno bolečino, brez odrešitve..."
Elena Ferrante je poznana po Neapeljskem ciklu, ki je postal globalni fenomen. V njem bralec spoznava Lilo in Eleno, ki sta več kot 60 let najboljši prijateljici, dokler ena od njiju ne izgine brez sledu, druga pa z obujanjem preteklosti poskuša rešiti uganko prijateljičinega izginotja. Njuno prijateljstvo, kot je popisano v skupaj štirih knjigah, pa je življenjsko, polno nežnosti, podpore, zbliževanj in oddaljevanj, ljubosumja in zavisti.
Tri knjige iz cikla - Genialna prijateljica, O novem priimku in O tistih, ki zbežijo, in tistih, ki ostanejo - so v slovenskem prevodu izšle pri Cankarjevi založbi. Napovedan je tudi izid slovenskega prevoda zadnje knjige z naslovom O izgubljeni deklici. V slovenščini je dostopno še pisateljičino delo Dnevi zavrženosti.
Po romanu Genialna prijateljica so posneli nadaljevanko, ki je v prvi sezoni po navedbah Anse v povprečju dosegla sedem milijonov gledalcev. Na italijanski televiziji Rai bodo drugi del serije, ki bo zajela dogajanje drugega romana iz cikla, začeli prikazovati prihodnje leto.
text:
Elena Ferrante with a new novel about the complicated life of adults
04 Nov 2019, 11:39 by STA

A new novel by an Italian writer introducing herself with the pseudonym Elena Ferrante will be released in Italy on Thursday. The author of the famous Naples Cycle has titled La vita bugiarda degli adulti (The Folded Life of Adults), and the cover of the Italian edition features women's hands raised as if they were to gently grasp something.



The cover of Elena Ferrante's new book, due out Thursday.

ROME> The Italian news agency Ansa writes that Elena Ferrante's new novel will almost certainly be set in Naples, suggesting an excerpt from a piece published in September: "Two years before he left home, my father told his mother that I was very nasty. The sentence was soft, in an apartment his parents bought at his wedding in the Alto neighborhood, at the top of San Giacomo dei Capri Street. Everything - the Naples premises, the blue light of the icy February, those words - was numb. away, and still glide within those lines that want to give me a story, while I am nothing, nothing of my own, nothing that would really begin or really conclude: just a mess for no one, not even those who he writes, he does not know whether he follows the narrative thread or whether it is merely an unordered pain, without salvation ... "
Elena Ferrante is known for the Naples cycle, which has become a global phenomenon. In it, the reader gets to know Lila and Elena, who are best friends for over 60 years, until one of them disappears without a trace and the other tries to solve the riddle of his friend's disappearance by awakening the past. Their friendship, as recorded in a total of four books, is life-long, full of tenderness, support, rapprochement and distance, jealousy and envy.
Three books from the cycle - The Ingenious Friend, About a New Last Name and About Those Who Escape and Those Who Remain - were published in Slovenian by Cankar's publishing house. The Slovenian translation of the latest book entitled About the Lost Girl is also announced. The writer 's work Days of Discard is also available in Slovenian.
According to the novel, The Ingenious Friend filmed a sequel that averaged seven million viewers in its first season, according to Anse. On Italian television Rai, the second part of the series, which will cover the events of the second cycle novel, will begin airing next year.
